prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We require single continuum observations in Band 7 with the maximum bandwidth of 7.5 GHz and 2-GHz for each baseband centered at 336.5, 338.5, 348.5 and 350.5 GHz with the lower spectral resulotion ~31MHz.

Imaging at optical and X-ray band of the binary QSOs in the sample has shown that the separations between the two members of the systems are 2.0<theta ''<6.0. This mean that a resolution of ~0.5 arcsec is needed to disentangle the multiple images in all the cases. ALMA band-7 can provide the desire resolution and study the submm emission not only for the system but also for the individual associated QSOs which will be unresolved.

Predicted Band 7 fluxes for all individual QSOs in the binary systems range between 4<S_7(mJy)<9. These predictions are uncertain by a factor of ~3. However, they indicate that with a 0.3 mJy sencitivity limit, we will reach a >5-sigma detection for the fainter member of the system even if the observed fluxes are 3 times lower that our predictions.

Imaging at optical and X-ray band of the binary QSOs in the sample has shown that the separations between the two members of the systems are 2.0<theta ''<6.0. However, they indicate that with a 0.3 mJy sencitivity limit, we will reach a >5-sigma detection for the fainter member of the system even if the observed fluxes are 3 times lower that our predictions.

We require spectral line observation of continumm in Band 7 in order to achive a better spectral resulotion (7.8 MHz) than the single continuum observation and study for these 2 binary QSOs the CO transition with 2-GHz for each baseband centered at 336.5, 338.0, 348.5 and 350.0 GHz and a spectral average of 16 channels to reduce the data rate.

Imaging at optical and X-ray band of the binary QSOs in the sample has shown that the separations between the two members of the systems are 2.0<theta ''<6.0. This mean that a resolution of ~0.5 arcsec is needed to disentangle the multiple images in all the cases. ALMA band-7 can provide the desire resolution and study the submm emission not only for the system but also for the individual associated QSOs which will be unresolved.

Predicted Band 7 fluxes for all individual QSOs in the binary systems range between 4<S_7(mJy)<9. These predictions are uncertain by a factor of ~3. The requested RMS will provide us with a S/N>10.0 continuum flux density, which is the requirement of this proposal.
As we can not make any assuptions for the flux density of the spectral lines, we will use this low resulotion spectrum, and the achieved S/N at the requested time as an extra bonus of our proposal. The detection of the spectral lines are not crusial for the purposes of our project.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose to use ALMA to obtain Band 7 continuum observations for 9 binary QSO pair systems at 0.4<z<2.4. All of our sources have been selected from the complete sample of 28 spectroscopically confirmed binary QSOs from SDSS, and have deep broad-band imaging and X-ray detections. We aim to compare their submm properties, a clear star-formation indicator, to the nearly ideal comparison sample of single QSOs observed by HerMES and SCUBA-2 in Lockman field in order to test check whether these systems are consistent with a merger-triggered scenario for QSO formation.
